title: Key Data Fields and Schema Structure
description: Overview of the essential data fields in Cisco Webex Calling CDRs

content.description: Uniquely identifies a call session
The phone numbers involved in the call
Specifies the nature of the call (e.g., inbound, outbound)
Indicates whether the call was incoming or outgoing
The length of the call
A boolean indicating if the call was answered
Timestamps for when the call began and ended
Identifies the user associated with the call

title: Types of Calls in CDRs
description: Different types of calls captured in Webex Calling CDRs and their implications

content.description: Calls received from an external number
Calls made to an external number
Calls within the organization
Inbound calls that were not answered

title: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) Techniques
description: How RAG can enhance AI interaction with CDRs by integrating external data
content: Integrate organizational hierarchies for internal call mapping
Leverage industry-specific communication patterns through knowledge graphs

title: AI-Powered Insights and Visualizations
description: Examples of AI-generated insights and visualizations from Webex Calling CDR data

content.description: Visualize call volume trends over time to predict future activity
Identify hotspots for call activities across different departments or geographies
Use historical data to forecast call volumes and optimize staffing
Gauge customer sentiment from call metadata for customer service improvements

title: Webex Calling CDR Call Types
description: Overview of the various call types captured in Webex Calling CDRs

content.description: Calls made via SIP to join a virtual meeting
International calls made over SIP
Incoming calls received over SIP

title: Key CDR Data Fields
description: Explanation of how key CDR data fields are populated for each call type

content.description: Specifies the type of call (e.g., SIP_MEETING)
Indicates whether the call is inbound or outbound
The number that was dialed by the caller
The number that received the call
The number that initiated the call

title: Industry-Specific Call Flows
description: Examples of common call flows in different industries and how they are reflected in CDR data

content.flow: A patient calls the main office, is redirected to a department, and then connected to a staff member
A parent calls the school's main line and is directed to the appropriate teacher or administrator
A customer calls for support and is routed to the correct service agent based on the query

title: Analyzing CDR Data for Insights
description: Guidance on identifying patterns, trends, and anomalies in CDR data across industries

content.description: The number of calls over a period
When the highest number of calls occur
Average length of calls

title: Structuring and Analyzing CDR Data in Power BI
description: Best practices for data modeling, visualization, and AI-powered features in Power BI

content.description: Create relationships between different data tables to reflect the complexity of call data
Develop dashboards that display call volumes, durations, and types over time
Implement anomaly detection to spot unusual call patterns and forecasting to predict future trends

title: Industry-Specific Analysis Using Webex Calling CDRs
description: Step-by-step guide for conducting industry-specific call analysis with Webex Calling CDRs using Power BI.

details: Use the Webex Calling API to import CDR data into Power BI.
Create relationships between call data and other business data (e.g., customer records, sales data).
Add calculated fields for industry-specific metrics (e.g., call resolution time in customer service).
Use line charts to visualize call volume trends over time.
Create heat maps to identify high-activity regions or departments.
Use pie charts to show the distribution of call types (SIP_MEETING, SIP_INBOUND, etc.).
Healthcare: Analyze call durations and types to optimize patient appointment scheduling and staff allocation.
Finance: Monitor international calls (SIP_INTERNATIONAL) to manage global operations and compliance.
Education: Track inbound calls (SIP_INBOUND) to improve parent-teacher communication and administrative support.
Customer Service: Evaluate call resolution times and follow-up rates to enhance customer satisfaction.
Set up alerts for unusual call patterns that may indicate issues like fraud or system malfunctions.
Use time-series analysis to predict future call volumes for better resource planning.
Create interactive dashboards tailored to different stakeholders (e.g., management, IT, customer service).
Generate automated reports with key findings and recommendations for each industry sector.
Develop targeted communication strategies based on call analysis.
Adjust staffing and infrastructure based on predicted call volumes and patterns.
Implement improvements in customer interaction based on insights from call data.

title: Webex Calling CDR Schema
description: Detailed schema for Webex Calling call detail records (CDRs)

fields.name: Answer indicator
fields.description: Whether the call leg was answered after a redirection. Possible values: Yes, No, Yes-PostRedirection

fields.name: Answer time
fields.description: The time the call was answered. Time is in UTC.

fields.name: Answered
fields.description: Whether the call leg was answered. For example, in a hunt group case, some legs will be unanswered, and one will be answered.

fields.name: Authorization code
fields.description: The authorization code admin created for a location or site for users to use. Collected by the Account/Authorization Codes or Enhanced Outgoing Calling Plan services.

fields.name: Call ID
fields.description: SIP Call ID used to identify the call. You can share the Call ID with Cisco TAC to help them pinpoint a call if necessary.

fields.name: Call outcome
fields.description: Identifies whether the call was set up or disconnected normally. Possible values: Success, Failure, Refusal

fields.name: Call outcome reason
fields.description: Additional information about the Call outcome returned.

fields.name: Call transfer Time
fields.description: Indicates the time at which the call transfer service was invoked during the call. The invocation time is shown using the UTC/GMT time zone format.

fields.name: Call type
fields.description: Type of call. For example: SIP_MEETING, SIP_INTERNATIONAL, SIP_SHORTCODE, SIP_INBOUND, UNKNOWN, SIP_EMERGENCY, SIP_PREMIUM, SIP_ENTERPRISE, SIP_TOLLFREE, SIP_NATIONAL, SIP_MOBILE

fields.name: Called line ID
fields.description: For incoming calls, the calling line ID of the user. For outgoing calls, it's the calling line ID of the called party.

fields.name: Called number
fields.description: For incoming calls, the telephone number of the user. For outgoing calls, it's the telephone number of the called party.

fields.name: Calling line ID
fields.description: For incoming calls, the calling line ID of the calling party. For outgoing calls, it's the calling line ID of the user.

fields.name: Calling number
fields.description: For incoming calls, the telephone number of the calling party. For outgoing calls, it's the telephone number of the user.

fields.name: Client type
fields.description: The type of client that the user (creating this record) is using to make or receive the call. For example: SIP, WXC_CLIENT, WXC_THIRD_PARTY, TEAMS_WXC_CLIENT, WXC_DEVICE, WXC_SIP_GW

fields.name: Client version
fields.description: The version of the client that the user (creating this record) is using to make or receive the call.

fields.name: Correlation ID
fields.description: Correlation ID to tie together multiple call legs of the same call session.

fields.name: Department ID
fields.description: A unique identifier for the user's department name.

fields.name: Device MAC
fields.description: The MAC address of the device, if known.

fields.name: Dialed digits
fields.description: The keypad digits as dialed by the user, before pre-translations. This field reports multiple call dial possibilities.

fields.name: Direction
fields.description: Whether the call was inbound or outbound. The possible values are: ORIGINATING, TERMINATING

fields.name: Duration
fields.description: The length of the call in seconds.

fields.name: Final local SessionID
fields.description: The value of the Local Session ID at the end of the call.

fields.name: Final remote SessionID
fields.description: The value of the Remote Session ID at the end of the call.

fields.name: Inbound trunk
fields.description: Inbound trunk may be presented in Originating and Terminating records.

fields.name: International country
fields.description: The country code of the dialed number. This is only populated for international calls.

fields.name: Local call ID
fields.description: A unique identifier that is used to correlate CDRs and call legs with each other.

fields.name: Local SessionID
fields.description: Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) generated from the Originating user agent.

fields.name: Location
fields.description: Location of the report.

fields.name: Model
fields.description: The device model type the user is using to make or receive the call.

fields.name: Network call ID
fields.description: A unique identifier that shows if other CDRs are in the same call leg. Two CDRs belong in the same call leg if they have the same Network call ID.

fields.name: Org UUID
fields.description: A unique identifier for the organization that made the call. This is a unique identifier across Cisco.

fields.name: Original reason
fields.description: Call redirection reason for the original called number.

fields.name: OS type
fields.description: The operating system that the app was running on, if available.

fields.name: Outbound trunk
fields.description: Outbound trunk may be presented in Originating and Terminating records.

fields.name: Release time
fields.description: The time the call was finished, in UTC.

fields.name: Ring duration
fields.description: The length of ringing before the call was answered or timed out, in seconds.

fields.name: Redirect reason
fields.description: Call Redirection Reason for the redirecting number.

fields.name: Redirecting number
fields.description: When the call has been redirected one or more times, this field reports the last redirecting number. Identifies who last redirected the call.

fields.name: Related call ID
fields.description: Call identifier of a different call that was created by this call because of a service activation. The value is the same as the Local call ID field of the related call.

fields.name: Related reason
fields.description: Indicates a trigger that led to a change in the call presence. The trigger could be for this particular call or redirected via a different call.

fields.name: Releasing party
fields.description: Indicates which party released the call first. The possible values are: Local, Remote, Unknown

fields.name: Remote call ID
fields.description: A unique identifier that is used to correlate CDRs and call legs with each other. This ID is used in conjunction with Local call ID to identity the local CDR of a call leg.

fields.name: Remote SessionID
fields.description: Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) generated from the Terminating user agent.

fields.name: Report ID
fields.description: A unique ID for this particular record. This can be used when processing records to aid in deduplication.

fields.name: Report time
fields.description: The time this report was created. Time is in UTC.

fields.name: Route group
fields.description: If present, this field's only reported in Originating records. Route group identifies the route group used for outbound calls routed via a route group to Premises-based PSTN or an on-prem deployment integrated with Webex Calling (dial plan or unknown extension).

fields.name: Site main number
fields.description: The main number for the user's site where the call was made or received.

fields.name: Site timezone
fields.description: Site timezone is the offset in minutes from UTC time of the user's timezone.

fields.name: Site UUID
fields.description: A unique identifier for the site associated with the call. Unique across Cisco products.

fields.name: Start time
fields.description: This is the start time of the call, the answer time may be slightly after this. Time is in UTC.

fields.name: Sub client type
fields.description: If the call is TO or FROM a mobile phone using Webex Go, the Client type will show SIP, and Sub client type will show MOBILE_NETWORK.

fields.name: Transfer related call ID
fields.description: Call identifier of a different call that was involved in the transfer. You can share this ID with Cisco TAC to help them pinpoint parties who were involved in the call transfer.

fields.name: User
fields.description: The user who made or received the call.

fields.name: User number
fields.description: Represents the E.164 number of the user generating a CDR. If the user has no number assigned to them, then their extension will be displayed instead.

fields.name: User type
fields.description: The type of user (user or workspace) that made or received the call.

fields.name: User UUID
fields.description: A unique identifier for the user associated with the call. This is a unique identifier across Cisco products.
